content.question: A particle moves along the x-axis so that its velocity at time t, 0 ≤ t ≤ 5, is given by v(t) = 3(t − 1)(t − 3). At time t = 2, the position of the particle is x(2) = 0. (a) Find the minimum acceleration of the particle.

frqParts.text: A particle moves along the x-axis so that its velocity at time t, 0 ≤ t ≤ 5, is given by v(t) = 3(t − 1)(t − 3). At time t = 2, the position of the particle is x(2) = 0. (a) Find the minimum acceleration of the particle.
(b) Find the total distance traveled by the particle.
(c) Find the average velocity of the particle over the interval 0 ≤ t ≤ 5.

topic.text: 4.2: Straight-Line Motion - Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
